page.title: 08Transport In All Areas
page.content: A main railway line,A38 road and the Trent and Mersey canal run through the area. The railway line carries both passengers and freight from the directions of Burton and Tamworth.The canal is now essentially for holiday barges.The A38,originally Rykneld St., is now a very busy dual carriageway. This summer the southbound carriageway from Barton to Wychnor was closed for repair and a contraflow system operated. A traffic survey showed that the majority of vehicles were cars.Next were long distance heavy goods lorries,carrying mainly food or building materials.There were several local light vans.225 cars were recorded in twenty minutes in one direction one Monday morning.This was the largest number recorded in any category.
